title: It is cruel for the Christian God to send 5-6 billion people to hell for not believing that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.

text:

But it's not. If you (general you, not you personally) have rejected Jesus then you have rejected your rescue plan, you have spit in the face of grace and mercy... now, all that is left... is fire.

text:
Look, the Christian god fails to measure up to my own moral standard.

I'm not the most loving or forgiving person in the world, but the Christian god is a hateful, vengeful, genocidal being that supposedly created a puppet race that he demands subservience from just to stroke his ego, and gave them some arbitrary rules to avoid eternal torture after they had been around for hundreds of thousands of years?
Mind you, there are hundreds of religions and he didn't intervene in any way to show that he is the real one?
These are traits of a being I cannot respect. I would sooner choose any of a dozen other belief systems that have a grasp for human empathy.

If he exists and chooses to burn me forever, that's his choice I guess, but it really seems like he wants to burn a ton of people if he's omnipotent and omniscient and still burns everybody who doesn't believe the right parts of a random bunch of letters stapled together that are full of contradictions.
